metadata.title: CVE-2022-4662 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: A flaw incorrect access control in the Linux kernel USB core subsystem wasfound in the way user attaches usb device. A local user could use this flawto crash the system.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
